revision.text:
{{Infobox person | name = Niecy Nash | image = Niecy Nash 2010.jpg | caption = Nash in June 2010. | birth_name = Carol Denise Ensley | birth_date = {{birth date and age|mf=yes|1970|2|23}} | birth_place = [[Compton, California]], U.S. | death_date = | death_place = | othername = | nationality = American | alma_mater = [[California State University, Dominguez Hills]] | home_town = [[Palmdale, California]]{{Citation needed|date=March 2015}} | occupation = Actress, comedian, television host, model, producer | yearsactive = 1995–present | television = ''Clean House'', ''Reno 911'', ''Claws'' | spouse = {{marriage|Don Nash|1994|2007|reason=divorced}}
{{marriage|Jay Tucker|May 28, 2011}} |website = {{url|http://www.niecynash.com/}} | children = 3 }} '''Carol Denise''' "'''Niecy'''" '''Nash''' ([[Married and maiden names|née]] '''Ensley''';According to the State of California. ''California Birth Index, 1905-1995''. Center for Health Statistics, California Department of Health Services, Sacramento, California. At Ancestry.com born February 23, 1970) is an American comedian, model, actress, and producer, best known for her performances on television. Nash hosted the [[Style Network]] show ''[[Clean House]]'' from 2003 to 2010, for which she won an [[Daytime Emmy Award|Emmy Award]] in 2010. As an actress, she played the role of Deputy [[Characters on Reno 911!#Dep. Williams|Raineesha Williams]] in the [[Comedy Central]] comedy series ''[[Reno 911!]]'' (2003–2009). Nash received two [[Primetime Emmy Award for Outstanding Supporting Actress in a Comedy Series]] and a [[Critics' Choice Television Award for Best Supporting Actress in a Comedy Series]] nominations for her performance as nurse Denise "DiDi" Ortley in the [[HBO]] comedy ''[[Getting On (U.S. TV series)|Getting On]]'' (2013–2015). She also starred as Lolli Ballantine on the [[TV Land]] sitcom ''[[The Soul Man (2012 TV series)|The Soul Man]]'' (2012–2016), and played Denise Hemphill in the Fox horror-comedy anthology series, ''[[Scream Queens (2015 TV series)|Scream Queens]]'' (2015–2016).{{cite web|url=http://www.eonline.com/news/628684/niecy-nash-joins-scream-queens-and-she-s-going-to-kick-butt|title=Niecy Nash Joins Scream Queens and She's Going to Kick Butt|work=E! Online|accessdate=17 July 2015}} In 2017, she began starring as Desna Simms, a leading character, in the TNT crime comedy-drama, ''[[Claws (TV series)|Claws]]''. Nash has also played a number of roles in films and has made many guest appearances on television shows. In 2014, Nash played the role of civil rights activist [[Richie Jean Jackson]] in the historical drama film ''[[Selma (film)|Selma]]'' directed by [[Ava DuVernay]]. ==Early life== Carol Denise Ensley was born in [[Compton, California|Compton]], [[California]]. In addition to her acting endeavors, she is the [[Spokesman|spokesperson]] of M.A.V.I.S. (Mothers Against Violence In Schools). M.A.V.I.S. was founded by her mother, after the 1993 shooting death of Nash's younger brother, Michael. M.A.V.I.S.'s mission is to inform the public of the [[School violence|violence children encounter on school campuses]]. Nash is a graduate of [[California State University, Dominguez Hills]].{{cite web|url=http://www.tvguide.com/celebrities/niecy-nash/bio/190691 |title=Niecy Nash Biography |publisher=Tvguide.com |date= |accessdate=2014-06-05}} ==Career== [[File:Niecy Nash Emmys 2008.jpg|170px|left|thumb|Nash at 2008 Emmys]] ===Early works=== Nash made her professional acting debut in the 1995 film ''[[Boys on the Side]]''. On television, she later guest-starred in ''[[NYPD Blue]]'', ''[[Judging Amy]]'', ''[[Reba (TV series)|Reba]]'', ''[[Girlfriends (U.S. TV series)|Girlfriends]]'', ''[[CSI: Crime Scene Investigation]]'' and ''[[ER (TV series)|ER]]''. She also appeared in 1999 film ''[[Cookie's Fortune]]'', and had a recurring role of [[CBS]] drama series, ''[[City of Angels (2000 TV series)|City of Angels]]'', in 2000. From 2003 to 2009, Nash played the role of Deputy [[Characters on Reno 911!#Dep. Williams|Raineesha Williams]] and T.T. on the [[Comedy Central]] comedy series ''[[Reno 911!]]''. In addition, Nash hosted ''[[Clean House]]'' on the [[Style Network]] from 2003 to 2010, as well as providing the voice of [[List of Slacker Cats characters|Mrs. Boots]] on the [[ABC Family]] animated series ''[[Slacker Cats]]'', and starred as Rhonda, opposite [[Jerry O'Connell]], in the short-lived [[Fox Broadcasting Company|Fox]] sitcom ''[[Do Not Disturb (TV series)|Do Not Disturb]]'' in 2008. She also has guest starred on ''[[The Bernie Mac Show]]'' as [[Bernie McCullough|Bernie's]] sister Bonita from 2003 to 2005. Nash won a Daytime Emmy in 2010 as the producer/host of "Clean House: The Messiest Home in the Country" in the category of Outstanding Special Class Special.{{cite web|url=http://www.niecynash.com/archives/2010/06/29/i-won-a-2010-daytime-emmy-award/ |title=I won a 2010 Daytime Emmy Award!! from Niecy Nash Official Web Site |publisher=Niecynash.com |date= |accessdate=2014-06-05}} On August 4, 2010 Nash announced she was leaving ''[[Clean House]]'' on the [[Style Network]] but the show will continue without her.Niecy Nash, [http://www.niecynash.com/archives/2010/08/04/the-end-of-clean-house/ The End of Clean House], August 4, 2010 [[File:Niecy Nash 2008.jpg|thumb|180px|Nash for 2008 commercial of Clorox Products]] Nash appeared on the [[Dancing with the Stars (U.S. season 10)|tenth season]] of ABC's ''[[Dancing with the Stars (U.S. TV series)|Dancing with the Stars]]'' beginning in March 2010, where she was partnered with [[Louis van Amstel]]. On May 11, 2010, Nash and van Amstel were eliminated from the competition, taking fifth place.Associate Press, [https://news.yahoo.com/s/ap/20100302/ap_en_ce/us_tv_dancing_with_the_stars New 'Dancing With the Stars' cast revealed], ''Yahoo! News'', March 1, 2010 In 2011 she got her own reality show ''Leave It To Niecy'' on [[TLC (TV network)|TLC]] about her life with her new husband and step-son but it was quickly cancelled. In that same year she was in a TLC wedding special.{{cite web|url=http://www.nydailynews.com/entertainment/tv-movies/tv-star-niecy-nash-back-reality-comedy-sadly-ends-funny-article-1.1049809 |title=TV star Niecy Nash is back with a reality-comedy which, sadly, ends up not being that funny |publisher=NY Daily News |date=2012-03-25 |accessdate=2014-06-05}}{{cite web|url=http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/live-feed/leave-it-to-niecy-tlc-nash-jay-tucker-preview-303417 |title=Niecy Nash on 'Leave It to Niecy': 'We Just Make Love, Money and Laughter' (Exclusive Video) |publisher=Hollywood Reporter |date=2012-03-22 |accessdate=2014-06-05}}{{cite web|last=Andreeva |first=Nellie |url=http://www.deadline.com/2011/11/tlc-orders-niecy-nash-docu-series/ |title=TLC Orders Niecy Nash Docu-Series |publisher=Deadline.com |date= |accessdate=2014-06-05}} She also appeared in films ''[[Code Name: The Cleaner]]'' (2007), ''[[Reno 911!: Miami]]'' (2007), ''[[Not Easily Broken]]'' (2009), ''[[G-Force (film)|G-Force]]'' (2009), and ''[[Trust Me (2013 film)|Trust Me]]'' (2013). ===2012-present=== In 2012, Nash began starring opposite [[Cedric the Entertainer]] in the [[TV Land]] sitcom ''[[The Soul Man (2012 TV series)|The Soul Man]]'', a spinoff from ''[[Hot in Cleveland]]''.{{cite web|last=Andreeva |first=Nellie |url=http://www.deadline.com/2011/11/niecy-nash-to-star-in-tv-lands-cedric-pilot-summer-glau-joins-tnts-scent/ |title=Niecy Nash To Star In TV Land's Cedric Pilot, Summer Glau Joins TNT's 'Scent' |publisher=Deadline.com |date= |accessdate=2014-06-05}} In 2013, she also began starring opposite [[Laurie Metcalf]] in the [[HBO]] comedy series ''[[Getting On (U.S. TV series)|Getting On]]''.{{cite web|last=Franich |first=Darren |url=http://insidetv.ew.com/2013/11/25/niecy-nash-hbo-getting-on/ |title=Niecy Nash talks new series 'Getting On' | Inside TV | EW.com |publisher=Insidetv.ew.com |date=2013-11-25 |accessdate=2014-06-05}} She received a [[Primetime Emmy Award for Outstanding Supporting Actress in a Comedy Series]] nomination for her role on the show in 2015 and 2016,{{cite web|url=https://variety.com/2015/tv/news/emmy-award-nominations-2015-full-list-1201537852/|title=Emmy Award Nominations 2015 – Full List: 67th Primetime Emmy Nominees - Variety|author=Variety Staff|work=Variety|accessdate=17 July 2015}} and well as [[Critics' Choice Television Award for Best Supporting Actress in a Comedy Series]] in 2016.{{cite web|url=http://tvline.com/2016/01/17/critics-choice-television-awards-winners-2016-full-list/|title=Critics' Choice Awards: TV Winners Include Fargo, Mr. Robot, Master of None, Rachel Bloom and Carrie Coon|first1=Matt Webb|last1=Mitovich|first2=Matt Webb|last2=Mitovich|date=18 January 2016|publisher=|accessdate=27 June 2016}} In 2014, Nash played [[Richie Jean Jackson]], the wife of Dr. Sullivan Jackson, in the historical drama film ''[[Selma (film)|Selma]]'', directed by [[Ava DuVernay]].{{cite web|url=http://blogs.indiewire.com/shadowandact/niecy-nash-signs-up-to-play-richie-jean-jackson-in-ava-duvernays-selma |title=Niecy Nash Signs Up To Play Richie Jean Jackson In Ava DuVernay's 'Selma'|Shadow and Act |publisher=Blogs.indiewire.com |date= |accessdate=2014-06-05}} ''Selma'' received acclaim from critics; on [[Rotten Tomatoes]], the film holds a rating of 99%, based on 205 reviews, with an average rating of 8.7/10.{{cite web | url=http://www.rottentomatoes.com/m/selma/ | title=Selma | work=[[Rotten Tomatoes]] | publisher=[[Flixster]] | accessdate=March 28, 2015}} ''Selma'' was listed on many critics' top ten lists.{{cite web|url=http://www.metacritic.com/feature/film-critic-top-10-lists-best-movies-of-2014 |title=Film Critic Top 10 Lists - Best Movies of 2014 |publisher=Metacritic |date= |accessdate=2015-05-16}} Also that year, she joined the cast of Fox comedy series, ''[[The Mindy Project]]'' in a recurring role as Dr. Jean Fishman, a rival of title character.{{cite web | url=http://insidetv.ew.com/2014/08/22/niecy-nash-the-mindy-project/ | title=Niecy Nash joins 'The Mindy Project' | publisher=Entertainment Weekly | date=August 22, 2014 | accessdate=24 August 2014 | author=Samantha Highfill}} In 2015, Nash was cast in the Fox horror-comedy anthology series, ''[[Scream Queens (2015 TV series)|Scream Queens]]'', as security guard, and then [[FBI]] Agent, Denise Hemphill. She appeared in another Fox comedy, ''[[Brooklyn Nine-Nine]]'' as [[Andre Braugher]]'s sister.{{cite web|url=http://www.ew.com/article/2015/11/20/brooklyn-nine-nine-scream-queens-niecy-nash-guest-star|title=Brooklyn Nine-Nine casts Scream Queens star Niecy Nash as Holt's sister - EW.com|publisher=|accessdate=18 January 2016}} The following year, she was cast in the leading role in the Fox comedy pilot ''The Enforcers''.{{cite web|url=http://deadline.com/2016/02/niecy-nash-star-the-enforncers-fox-comedy-pilot-1201704837/|title=Niecy Nash To Star In Fox Comedy Pilot ‘The Enforcers’|author=Nellie Andreeva|work=Deadline|accessdate=18 February 2016}}{{cite web|url=http://tvline.com/2016/02/18/niecy-nash-the-enforcers-fox-comedy-pilot-cast/|title=Niecy Nash Cast in ‘The Enforcers’ — Fox Comedy Pilot - TVLine|author=Michael Ausiello|work=TVLine|accessdate=18 February 2016}} The pilot was not ordered to series. She later was cast as lead in the TNT crime comedy-drama pilot ''[[Claws (TV series)|Claws]]'' produced by [[Rashida Jones]] about South Florida nail salons.{{cite web|url=http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/live-feed/niecy-nash-star-tnt-dramedy-895216|title=Niecy Nash to Star in TNT Dramedy 'Claws'|publisher=|accessdate=27 June 2016}}{{cite web|url=http://deadline.com/2016/05/niecy-nash-cast-tnt-claws-pilot-dramedy-1201758527/|title=Niecy Nash Joins TNT’s ‘Claws’ Pilot|first=Denise|last=Petski|date=18 May 2016|publisher=|accessdate=27 June 2016}} She also was cast in a recurring role as Louise Bell in the Showtime period drama ''[[Masters of Sex]]''.{{cite web|url=http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/live-feed/masters-sex-adds-niecy-nash-901145|title='Masters of Sex' Adds Niecy Nash, 'Nurse Jackie's' Betty Gilpin for Season 4|publisher=|accessdate=27 June 2016}} In 2017, Nash appeared in [[Mary J. Blige]]'s music video "[[Strength of a Woman (album)|Strength of a Woman]]".{{cite web|url=http://www.essence.com/celebrity/mary-j-blige-video-claws|title=Mary J. Blige Debuts New Strength Of A Woman Video Featuring Niecy Nash, Karrueche Tran|publisher=|accessdate=28 May 2018}} ==Personal life== Nash was married for 15 years to Don Nash, an ordained [[Minister (Christianity)|minister]], before filing for [[divorce]] in June 2007. They have three children; Dominic, Donielle, and Dia.{{cite web|url= http://www.niecynash.com/|title= Official site|deadurl= yes|archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20060806030652/http://niecynash.com/|archivedate= 2006-08-06|df= }}{{Failed verification|date=June 2011}} Niecy Nash became engaged to Jay Tucker on September 7, 2010.{{cite web|url=http://www.okmagazine.com/2010/09/niecy-nash-is-engaged-to-the-mr-wonderful-jay-tucker/|title=OK Magazine, Niecy Nash is Engaged to the "Mr. Wonderful" Jay Tucker!|author=Nicole Eggenberger|date=September 7, 2010|accessdate=September 7, 2010|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20100908204158/http://www.okmagazine.com/2010/09/niecy-nash-is-engaged-to-the-mr-wonderful-jay-tucker/|archivedate=September 8, 2010|df=}} Nash participated in a TLC reality show that followed the preparations for the wedding.TLC, [http://tlc.howstuffworks.com/tv/niecy-nashs-wedding-bash 'Niecy Nash Wedding Bash] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20110606073106/http://tlc.howstuffworks.com/tv/niecy-nashs-wedding-bash |date=2011-06-06 }}, ''TLC'', June 4, 2011 Nash and Tucker were married on Saturday May 28, 2011 at the Church Estate Vineyard in Malibu.{{cite web|url=http://www.essence.com/galleries/black-love-niecy-nash-and-jay-tuckers-wedding|title=Niecy Nash and Jay Tucker's Wedding|author=Peen, Charli|publisher=''Essence.com''|date=June 2, 2011|accessdate=January 7, 2017}} ==Filmography== ===Film=== {| class="wikitable sortable" |- ! Year ! Title !
